triplets: Vegetable from the Brassica family, grown for its dense leafy head
Eating raw in salads, cooking in soups, stews, stir-fries, fermentation (sauerkraut), and pickling
Vegetable plant; mainly leaves are consumed
Green, purple, or red depending on variety
Vegetable crops, healthy diet, culinary ingredients
Approximately 0.5–3 kg per head depending on variety and growth
Typically 20–50 cm depending on variety and cultivation
3–4 months in cultivation; harvested heads last 1–2 weeks when stored properly
